sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Conservative leader Petteri Oppo claims victory in Finland's election, knocking Prime Minister Sanna Marin's party into third place.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Fighting continues in Ukraine as Russia's Wagner Group claims to have taken control over Bakhmut.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: A woman is arrested following the St. Petersburg bomb blast that killed pro-Kremlin blogger Vladlen Tatarski. Interfax reports.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: The centre-right Gerb party of former Prime Minister Boyko Borisov leads the count after Bulgaria's fifth general election in two years.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Finland's centre-right leader Pateri Åpo, celebrating after he claimed victory for his National Coalition party in Sunday's tightly fought parliamentary elections.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Now with 48 of the 200 seats in parliament, he will have the first chance at forming a coalition government. I think that Finnish people want change.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: They want change and now I will start negotiations, open negotiations with all parties and I have one crucial issue and it is economy.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: We have to fix our economy, we have to do reforms to boost our economy and growth.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Prime Minister Sanna Marin's ruling Social Democratic Party was knocked into third place, winning 43 seats.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: But she put on a brave face as she conceded defeat.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: The head of the far right, Finnns party Rike Pyrrö, thanked her supporters for a second place result with 46 seats. You have never made this party the best election ever.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Under Finland's system of proportional representation to run the country, a coalition must muster more than 100 seats in the 200-seat parliament.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Negotiations are expected to be tough.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Russia's Wagner Group says it has control over the Ukrainian city of Bakhmut in the legal sense,

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: a claim Ukraine denies and says the battle is ongoing.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile, Kyiv has condemned an attack by Russian forces on a residential area in the Donetsk region that killed at least six people on Sunday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Ukraine's national police released footage it said showed the aftermath of the strike.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The fighting for Bakhmut is one of the bloodiest and longest since the war in Ukraine began.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: But strategic importance is disputed by Ukraine's allies.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Ukraine's president says the fighting for the city is particularly hot and that forces still hold it.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: In the past, the Wagner Group has made premature claims that had taken control of Bakhmut, which later were revealed to be false. Founded in Russia in 2013, the Wagner Group calls itself a private military company. But it actually is a de facto extension of the Russian security organs and apparatuses,

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: in particular the main intelligence directorate.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: More than 80 percent of its members are convicts, and UN experts have denounced the use of pressure tactics by Wagner recruiters.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: The training center is very close to the GRU base over there. So that is very interesting, because it shows the linkages, perhaps, between the intelligence services of Russia and the Wagner Group.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: GRANT HARDY, Wagner soldiers are deployed in various countries where Russia's interests are at stake.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Starting off in Donbass, then in Syria, then in Libya, and then throughout many different sub-Saharan African conflict areas like Mozambique, Mali, and the South African Republic.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The U.S. estimates that Wagner has some 50,000 troops fighting in Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Heavy casualties in Bakhmut, as well as a shortage of prisoner recruitments, and the uncertain success of his other recruitment efforts have likely diminished the number.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: and the uncertain success of his other recruitment efforts have likely diminished the number.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: The group's leader is Yevgeny Prigozhin, a St. Petersburg oligarch with an unusual success story.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: After being imprisoned in the 1980s, he took charge of the Kremlin's catering service the following decade. Today, the man known as Putin's chef owns companies in the audiovisual, mining, consulting and military sectors.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Prigozhin's power is inextricably linked to his long-standing relationship with Vladimir Putin.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: He does control mining assets in Africa that are quite lucrative, gold and diamonds, but he doesn't control the kind of formally recognized state-owned companies that most other oligarchs have.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: But it's not all smooth sailing. Prigozhin has rivals among top Russian military officials, including Valery Gerasimov, chief of the general staff of Russia's armed forces and architect of the war in Ukraine. Prigozhin likes to claim that he's effectively running an army within an army.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: It's got jets, it's got missile defenses, it's got ammunition and various types of artillery.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: But in fact, it's becoming increasingly reliant on outside supply.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: So I don't think that Prigozhin has a very important role in terms of frontline strategy and decision-making outside of the context of Donetsk.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Wagner soldiers have been accused of war crimes, including torture and rape, in the areas where they've been deployed.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Of course, those who decide to live in Russia and stay in Russia permanently will probably find it very difficult to be actually prosecuted in person because Russia is not a party to the ICC and Russia has a policy of not extraditing its citizens to these international bodies or certainly to Ukrainian or Western courts.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: And though Putin has not officially endorsed the Wagner Group, Russia's lower house of parliament recently approved a bill which would punish anyone found discrediting volunteer groups fighting in Ukraine with up to 15 years in prison.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: A woman has been arrested following the St. Petersburg cafe bomb blast that killed

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: pro-Kremlin blogger Vladlen Tatarski, Interfax news agency reports.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Tatarski was speaking at a public meeting in the cafe on Sunday when the bomb went off, injuring 30.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Eyewitnesses said that shortly before the blast, he had placed a bust of himself on a nearby table.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Tatarski had more than 560,000 followers on Telegram. Unlike many other commentators, he frequently visited the front line. While backing the war, he criticized the generals running it. And a Ukrainian government official blamed his death on internal divisions, saying spiders are eating each other in a jar.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: The centre-right Gerb party of former Prime Minister Boyko Borisov is leading in the count after Bulgaria's fifth general election in two years.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: With 26% of the vote, Gerb has a narrow lead over the We Continue the Change party of another ex-premier Kirill Petkov.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Analysts say that rivalry between the two leaders will make coalition talks difficult.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The two parties in coalition with the best results, who have the same Euro-Atlantic positions about the war in Ukraine, about the Eurozone, the entrance of Bulgaria in the Eurozone, about Schengen.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: I think they are not going to sit on the same table and to make a coalition.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: That's why I think that we shall continue with the political crisis in Bulgaria.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Turnout was just 38% of the electorate.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The DPS, a liberal party with strong support in the Turkish and Roma minorities, said it would be open to coalition talks after scoring 13%. The pro-Russian nationalist Revival Party came third, but excluded entering a coalition.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Bulgaria needs political stability if it's to implement institutional reforms required to unlock 5 billion euros in EU recovery plan funding.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Celebrations in Montenegro after former economy minister Jakov Milatovic declared victory in the presidential election runoff.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: It represents a major loss for the long-standing incumbent Milo Djukanovic, who has been at the helm of the former Yugoslav Republic since 1991 and later oversaw its declaration of independence in 2006.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Milo Tovic is vowing to now lead the Balkan nation into the European Union.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: But this new role will mostly be a ceremonial one.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Parisians have voted overwhelmingly to ban for hire electric scooters from the city streets

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: in what is seen as a victory for road safety campaigners.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: In a referendum in the French capital on Sunday, 90% of voters backed the ban.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: While they're a hit with tourists, many Parisians complain that the scooters are an eyesore and a traffic menace.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Since their introduction, they've been involved in hundreds of accidents, some of them fatal.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Now the 15,000 self-service scooters will vanish from Paris at the end of August.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Communities across large parts of the United States are cleaning up the wreckage

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: left behind by dozens of tornadoes that crossed through the South and Midwest over the weekend. At least 32 people have been killed so far, but there are fears that number could grow. U.S. President Joe Biden has declared tornado hit parts of the country, major disaster areas, giving many of the region's residents access to federal resources and financial aid to help rebuild.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Confirmed or suspected tornadoes hit 11 states, destroying homes and businesses and laying waste to entire neighborhoods.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Tornadoes can happen at any time in the United States, but they are most common from April to June.
